Message.Title: Paul Thurott - A trusted source at Microsoft stated Surface Pro “inventory constraints” were indeed quite real
Message.Msg: "A trusted source at Microsoft told me earlier in the week that the Surface Pro “inventory constraints” that marred the opening launch weekend were indeed quite real " "Another Saturday, another round of Surface with Windows 8 Pro sales. But this time, things are a little bit different. Yes, the 128 GB version is still scarce. But Microsoft’s online store is now taking waiting list orders, with shipment expected by March 1..

with the Surface Pro: I can work my spread sheet, type a report, then print it for my presentation at work. Work makes me $157/hr. that's a salary of $400,000. Tablets: can't do anything productive but I can sure use wifi for internet surfing, play cut the rope, download pics, play angry bird, play more angry bird, more angry bird, then I get angry for not being on angry bird. end result: saved $1260 but can't do work (not making the $400,000 year)

with my surface pro, I can hook it up to the internet (don't have to have a wifi), look up for massages, call those masseur girls over. While waiting for the massage girls, I flip it to a tablet, play some angry bird and download some porn. When the masseur girls finally arrived at my home, I finally got my massage and the happy ending. And I am still $398,000 richer than if I had a pure tablet alone.

Message.Title: Byout
Message.Msg: who will microsoft by out to improve the company?

I don't think they need to buyout any company. They have the Software with Windows and Office. They are now mobile market with Windows 8 smartphones and the Surface tablets. As long as Window 8 catches on the the mobile arena, they will do just fine. The PC market has been diminishing and those who use PCs and like Windows 7 can stick with it for quite sometime. I have a Windows HTC 8x smartphone and am satisfied with it. It will take time for it to get the apps I and others like.

That sounds like a broken record. I do think that those who have owned Apple for sometime have done extremely well. But I don't think that growth will continue. Too much competition. Microsoft will have its day to shine for us slow and steady investors.

Message.Title: Sandy Relief Fund????
Message.Msg: OH NO TRUTH....OHHHH NOOOO! The REAL TRUTH about the Hurricane Sandy relief bill. Maybe now you can understand why John Beohner and the GOP were a little reluctant. (If in doubt, go research it yourself.) The thieves at their best; grab the money and run. Just some of the pork in the Sandy bill: $4 million for the Kennedy Space Center . $8 million to buy cars and equipment for the Homeland Security and Justice departments. $20 million for a nationwide "Water Resources Priorities Study". $41 million for eight military bases including Guantanamo Bay . $56.8 million for charting the debris from last year's Japanese tsunami. $58.8 million for forest restoration on private land. $100 million for the federal Head Start day care program. $150 million in funding for Alaskan fisheries. $188 million for new Amtrak lines (not repair, whole new lines). $197 million “to… protect coastal ecosystems and habitat impacted by Hurricane Sandy.” $5.3 billion to the Army Corps of Engineers (that's more than their annual budget). $10.78 billion for public transportation, most of which is allocated to future construction and improvements, not disaster relief. $13 billion would go to “mitigation” projects to prepare for future storms $17 billion for wasteful Community Development Block Grants (CDBG), a program that has become notorious for its use as a backdoor earmark program.

European project for ice coring in Antarctica. 740,000 years old creekydummy. ""This site (75°06′S 123°21′E, 3233 m above sea level, 560 km from Vostok Station) was chosen to obtain the longest undisturbed chronicle of environmental change, in order to characterise climate variability over several glacial cycles, and to study potential climate forcings and their relationship to events in other regions. The core goes back 740,000 years and reveals 8 previous glacial cycles. Drilling was completed at this site in December 2004, reaching a drilling depth of 3270.2 m, 5 m above bedrock.""

Message.Title: Windows 8 Feature and Smartphones
Message.Msg: MSFT long holders should look at Nokia as their next phone purchase. Windows 8 smartphones and feature are here now. Nokia is very complimentary to W8. Reviews are extremely good and the demand is exceeding initial supplies. Essentially connecting software and integration with mobile communications hardware.
too funny! who will be next dead meat after aapl and msft? any guess?

Got to agree with you here... Windows 8 is speedier and go head to head with Apple... Microsoft tablets are starting to be better for Video Editing, and they have caught up with Apple in my opinion.... Users will not move back to Apple for a while after years of bugs and crashes, but I don't see too many larger companies moving to Apple for their main OS... In fact, many friends who use Apple across the board are starting to complain that incompatibility outside the Apple realm still exist.... With that said, I'm looking for a new device to aid in my work, and am leaning Android at this time. 10" tablet with keyboard... A Windows 8 device is not ruled out, but weight and performance are a factor, So the Surface Pro will not do.... Many Android devices are missing ports of various styles, so there is not a solution for me out there where Price ( $350 or less ), Weight ( 1.0 pound less ), performance ( Speed of an Ipad 3 ) , HDMI, sdcard reader.. 1920 x 1080 screen minimum... I must admit, I would consider a Windows 8 laptop for $1200, if I didn't already have a decent laptop.... I need something small and light, and bigger than my Galaxy SII or a Galaxy Note....
